# Pre-lecture activities

Before class, read chapter 4 titled *"Visualizing Data in the Tidyverse"* from the **Tidyverse Skills for Data Science** Book by Carrie Wright, Shannon E. Ellis, Stephanie C. Hicks, and Roger D. Peng.

Reading: [Visualizing Data in the Tidyverse](https://jhudatascience.org/tidyversecourse/dataviz.html)

For more examples, you can checkout a YouTube video series on ggplot from Dr. Lace Padilla.

1. [Mastering ggplot2 in R](https://youtu.be/iYGDhcNCWDI?si=npvVMpihW-0puqy1)     [17 min]
2. [Mastering Axes in ggplot2](https://youtu.be/Iw3LEa7nxQE?si=B0UTEifi9y1-vLIz)  [16 min]
3. [Color Magic in ggplot2](https://youtu.be/50o5UQHbkdI?si=WeGH8WBP2pNRkTsz)     [12.5 min]
4. [Mastering Facet_Wrap in ggplot2](https://youtu.be/U7i5FozHkW8?si=7wkiGp65r_lQgdit) [15 min]


# Lecture

## Learning objectives

::: callout-note
### Learning objectives

**At the end of class you will be able to:**

-   Distinguish between good and bad plots
-   Match the type of plots with the type of data input
-   List the features of the grammer of graphics
-   Build complex graphics in ggplot2

:::
